DataElement.preferredName: Non-MRI Compatible Metal Or Medical Device Implantation Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response for questions related to the presence of MR imaging incompatible objects and/or devices.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Non-MRI Compatible Metal Or Medical Device Implantation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues._Able to exist in combination.__Electropositive chemical elements characterised by ductility, malleability, luster, and conductance of heat and electricity._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions._A surgical procedure that places something in the human body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Property.preferredName: Compatible Metal Or Medical Device Implantation
Property.preferredDefinition: Able to exist in combination.:Electropositive chemical elements characterised by ductility, malleability, luster, and conductance of heat and electricity. They can replace the hydrogen of an acid and form bases with hydroxyl radicals.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.:A surgical procedure that places something in the human body.

Concepts.definition: Electropositive chemical elements characterised by ductility, malleability, luster, and conductance of heat and electricity. They can replace the hydrogen of an acid and form bases with hydroxyl radicals.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.
A surgical procedure that places something in the human body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 requested By Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership  transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/23/16 jk value "Not evaluable" added in error by COG on 3/21/16 was removed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN 6690
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant have metallic objects or implanted medical devices in the body which are incompatible with MRI per institutional safety standards?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Presence of MRI-incompatible
ReferenceDocuments.description: Presence of MRI-incompatible metallic objects or implanted medical devices

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN 4112
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have metallic objects or implanted medical devices in body?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EA1141 Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there any presence of non MR compatible metallic objects or metallic objects that, in the opinion of the radiologist, would make MRI a contraindication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have implanted medical device(s) that pose a high risk for colonization and/or cannot be easily removed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAI141 CRF
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does participant have MRI incompatible implants/devices or metallic foreign bodies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAF151 CRF
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have MRI incompatible implants/devices or metallic foreign bodies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF-97415
ReferenceDocuments.description: Those with ferromagnetic cerebral aneurysm clips or other intraorbital/intracranial metal; pacemakers, defibrillators, functioning neurostimulator devices, non-compatible MRI tissue expanders or breast implants, or other implanted non-compatible MRI devices

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF-97415 healthy
ReferenceDocuments.description: Those with ferromagnetic cerebral aneurysm clips or other intraorbital/intracranial metal; pacemakers, defibrillators, functioning neurostimulator devices, or other implanted non-compatible MRI devices
